name: Maple Bacon Cheddar Biscuits
description: Soft, tender, oh-so-flaky biscuits the whole family will love! Wtih crisp bacon and maple syrup, what could be better, right?

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Drain excess fat; transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add bacon and cook until brown and crispy, about 6-8 minutes. Drain excess fat; transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine bacon, flour, cheese, baking powder, salt and baking soda.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine bacon, flour, cheese, baking powder, salt and baking soda.

recipeInstructions.text: Grate butter using the large holes of a box grater. Stir into the flour mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Grate butter using the large holes of a box grater. Stir into the flour mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together buttermilk and 4 tablespoons maple syrup. Add to the flour mixture and stir using a rubber spatula until a soft dough forms.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, whisk together buttermilk and 4 tablespoons maple syrup. Add to the flour mixture and stir using a rubber spatula until a soft dough forms.

recipeInstructions.text: Working on a lightly floured surface, knead the dough 3-4 times until it comes together. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 1 1/4-inch thick rectangle. Cut out 12 rounds using a 2 to 2 1/2-inch biscuit or cookie cutter. Place biscuits onto the prepared baking sheet; place in the freezer for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Working on a lightly floured surface, knead the dough 3-4 times until it comes together. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough into a 1 1/4-inch thick rectangle. Cut out 12 rounds using a 2 to 2 1/2-inch biscuit or cookie cutter. Place biscuits onto the prepared baking sheet; place in the freezer for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove biscuits from freezer. Place into oven and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove biscuits from freezer. Place into oven and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons maple syrup and butter.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons maple syrup and butter.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve biscuits warm, brushed with the maple-butter mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve biscuits warm, brushed with the maple-butter mixture.

review.reviewBody: Do you think I can use almond flour instead of regular flour?
These would make excellent breakfast sandwiches with a fried egg and cheese!
Could these biscuits be made as drop biscuits ???
Can I make these ahead and freeze overnight before I bake them

Still making these oh so yummy biscuits regularly as my family request them with soups and stews.  Today to go with chicken noodle soup currently simmering away in my Instant Pot on slow cook.  Today I made sure the butter was well frozen and used my rather vintage food processor to grate the the butter.  What a time and frustration saver as I do not enjoy grating slippery butter by hand!

You had at LEAST two more biscuits there! Waste not, want not. YUM YUM !!
BTW. I don’t have a website.
Looks delicious, can not wait to try...

I made these biscuits tonight to accompany home made pea and barley and soup.  They turned out great.  A bit more work than other biscuits, but worth it.

I added chopped chives and fresh sage, which complemented the soup well.

I had difficulty fitting the baking trays in my freezer so took the biscuits off and put in the freezer without the trays.

Thank you for another great recipe.
These are worth every bit of effort they take to make. They’re delicious! I know this will be a recipe I return to again and again!
I have been making this recipe for two years now and my family LOVES it! Thank you for this wonderfully delicious recipe!!!
I made these using gluten free flour and they are delicious! Family loved them and I’d certainly make again.
